title: Rome IV Diagnostic Criteria for Infant Functional Constipation
desc: The Rome IV criteria for infant functional constipation provides criteria for the diagnosis of infant functional constipation.

orgreference.text: Benninga MA, Faure C, Hyman PE, St james roberts I, Schechter NL, Nurko S. Childhood Functional Gastrointestinal Disorders: Neonate/Toddler. Gastroenterology. 2016; 1443-1455.

data.evidence:
To fulfill the Rome IV criteria for infant functional constipation, patient must have 1 month of ≥2 of the following (for infants <4 years of age):

  1. ≤2 defecations per week.
  2. History of excessive stool retention.
  3. History of painful or hard bowel movements.
  4. History of large-diameter stools.
  5. Presence of a large fecal mass in the rectum.

In toilet-trained children, the following additional criteria may be used:

  1. At least 1 episode/week of incontinence after the acquisition of toileting skills.
  2. History of large-diameter stools that may obstruct the toilet.
